-- First Plushie!
-- Needed for calculating time -- r = game:service("RunService")
-- Store the Tool information local Tool = script.Parent
-- Variable for making sure our function is entered only once during a particular instance enabled = true local sitting_on_character = false
-- Sounds
local onPickup_s1 = Instance.new("Sound") onPickup_s1.SoundId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=45428575" onPickup_s1.Parent = Tool.Handle
local onSit_s1 = Instance.new("Sound") onSit_s1.SoundId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=45428516" onSit_s1.Parent = Tool.Handle
local onSit_s2 = Instance.new("Sound") onSit_s2.SoundId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=45428590" onSit_s2.Parent = Tool.Handle
local onSit_s3 = Instance.new("Sound") onSit_s3.SoundId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=45428545" onSit_s3.Parent = Tool.Handle
local onDrop_s1 = Instance.new("Sound") onDrop_s1.SoundId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=45428486" onDrop_s1.Parent =Tool.Handle
local sit_sounds = {onSit_s1, onSit_s2, onSit_s3} local hold_sounds = {onPickup_s1, onDrop_s1} local all_sounds = {onSit_s1, onSit_s2, onSit_s3, onPickup_s1, onDrop_s1}
-- Three functions for onActivate, onEquip and onUnEquip
function onActivated()
-- Need to do this particular check, so that it disables multiple instances of this function getting activated if not enabled then return end -- If the above constraint fails, then lock it -- This lock is tentative since during multithreading there is still a chance for there to be multiple instances of this function enabled = false
-- Check to see if the robot is sitting on the character if not sitting_on_character then sitting_on_character = true Tool.Handle.Mesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=45450768" Tool.GripForward = Vector3.new(0, -1, 0) Tool.GripPos = Vector3.new(-0.5, -1.5, -0.5) Tool.GripRight = Vector3.new(-1, 0, 0) Tool.GripUp = Vector3.new(0, 0, 1) sit_sounds[math.random(1, #sit_sounds)]:Play() wait(2)
else sitting_on_character = false Tool.Handle.Mesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=45450798" Tool.GripForward = Vector3.new(0, -1, 0) Tool.GripPos = Vector3.new(0, 0, 0) Tool.GripRight = Vector3.new(-1, 0, 0) Tool.GripUp = Vector3.new(0, 0, 1) hold_sounds[math.random(1, #hold_sounds)]:Play() wait(2) end enabled = true end
function onEquipped() -- Unmute all Sounds for i=1, #all_sounds do all_sounds[i].Volume = 1 end end
function onUnequipped() -- Mute all Sounds for i=1,#all_sounds do all_sounds[i].Volume = 0 end end
-- This is to connect our function to the Activate functionality of the Player Character! script.Parent.Activated:connect(onActivated) script.Parent.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) script.Parent.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)
